Characteristics of Bayesian Networks (2/2)
4. Learning the structure of a Bayesian network is a difficult task
– Often requires assistance from expert knowledge
– However, once the structure has been decided, learning the probabilistic 
tables can be quite straightforward
5. Due to its additional ability of representing complex forms of 
relationships, Bayesian networks are more susceptible to 
overfitting as compared to the naïve Bayes classifier
– Furthermore, Bayesian networks typically require more training instances 
for effectively learning the probability tables than the naïve Bayes 
classifier
